classification: Daiginjo Futsu-shu Ginjo Honjozo Junmai Junmai Daiginjo Junmai Ginjo Special Sake Tokubetsu Honjozo Tokubetsu Junmai Style Aged for
description_en:
Hourai Jousen is an award-winning sake and an exceptional futsushu. It displays an elegant, clean fruitiness reminiscent of higher-grade sake, supported by a rich, satisfying texture. Brewed from plump steamed rice polished to 70%, the palate is round with gentle acidity, a touch of sweetness and fine intensity. The aroma is fresh and clean, with notes of cedar and nutmeg, while the flavours bring citrus and floral apricot, finishing rounded and pure.
Watanabe Hourai is based in central Japan in the charming town of Hida-Furukawa, Gifu Prefecture.

classification: Daiginjo Junmai Daiginjo Style Aged for
description_en:
Aizu Homare's Kiwami Junmai Daiginjo is made from Gohyakuman-Goku Rice that is polished up to 50% and Association 1801 yeast. The brewery states that this affordable Junmai Daiginjo was made to enjoy at home. The Kiwami has an elegant scent and a crispy, powerful taste, expertly manufactured by master brewer Nakajima. He has won fourteen gold medals at the National New Sake Competition and the IWC, the world's leading wine competition.
 Best to combine with white fish and shellfish sashimi, smoked ham, smoked duck.

classification: Junmai Ginjo Style Barrel aged Chokarakuchi Genshu Jikagumi Kimoto Limited edition Muroka Nama Nama-chozo Nigori Space Rice Space Yeast Sparkling Taru Usu-nigori Yamahai Zeewater Content
description_en:
Toko Chokarakuchi from Kojima Sohonten located in Yamagata is a super dry sake, also known as Chokarakuchi. This traditional sake made with local rice, has a mild aftertaste so that this is called a "daily sake" in Japan.
Nice companion of classic Japanese dishes such as Yakiimo, Shabu Shabu and Yakimono.
This sake is best served cold in a wine glass.
